definitions: A group of travelers, as merchants or pilgrims, journeying together for safety in passing through deserts, hostile territory, etc.
A large covered vehicle for conveying passengers, goods, a portable lodging, etc., especially one designed for long-distance travel.
A covered wagon or motor vehicle equipped as traveling living quarters.
examples: They joined the caravan crossing the desert.
The family vacationed in a caravan during the summer.
